dt: {bc}an alcoholic drink taken before a meal as an appetizer

et: borrowed from French {it}apéritif,{/it} from {it}apéritif,{/it} adjective, "aperient, stimulating appetite," going back to Old French {it}aperitif{/it} "aperient," borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}aperitīvus,{/it} variant of Late Latin {it}apertīvus,{/it} from Latin {it}apertus,{/it} past participle of {it}aperīre{/it} "to open" + {it}-īvus{/it} {et_link|-ive|-ive} {ma}{mat|aperient|}{/ma}
shortdef: an alcoholic drink taken before a meal as an appetizer
